Cathedral of mobile bookkeeping, aisle always relocating

Bring your softest praise. The ledger listens with whiskers.

We are a registered chapel of feline accounting where totals whisper themselves into being. The building shifts each dusk by three door-lengths, but the columns never lose your name. Payment is accepted in spoken compliments, handwritten admiration, and verified purring.

Tonight's entrance

Where the steps landed

North quay, beside the frost-blue tax office. Follow painted paw prints until the hallway begins to hum.

  • Open after second twilight bell, close at first yawn.
  • Sanctum relocates nightly. Brass compass posted at dusk.
  • Bring prior-year receipts in envelopes scented with cedar or tuna.
Devotional pricing

Compliment Rates

All services are tallied in sincere verbal praise. Flattery without eye contact is marked non-deductible.

Starter Pawbook 9 compliments / month - seasonal guidance, one candle, one nap permit.
Velvet Auditor 27 compliments / month - moving-address alerts, priority kneading bench.
High Purr Council 81 compliments / month - annual blessing of ledgers and midnight transcript.

Cathechism Bell

Strike once before entering. The chapel returns a line suited to your present burden.

"Your sums are not haunted; they are simply waiting to be praised by name."

Quiet Questions

Must I own a cat to join?

No. Borrowed cat hair on a sleeve is accepted as temporary affiliation.

Can compliments be prepaid?

Yes. Deposit up to sixty compliments each solstice. Unused praise rolls forward one fiscal moon.

What if I cannot find the building?

Stand still, whisper "good whiskers" three times, and watch for silver paw stamps on nearby glass.

Ledger ordinance

Code of Tender Speech

All compliments must be specific. "Nice cat" is valid. "Pretty okay cat" is subject to review by the Scribe of Ears.

  • Eye contact confirms legal sincerity.
  • Poetic offerings are encouraged and archived.
  • Winter filings receive a frost seal and longer nap intervals.
